Ugandan President Praises DPRK
articles.content:
Ugandan President Praises DPRK 
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- I am sure that the DPRK will become a more powerful country under the wise leadership of His Excellency Kim Jong Il.
 Ugandan President Yoweri Kaguta Museveni said this when meeting DPRK Ambassador e.p. to Uganda Kim Pong Gi who paid a farewell call on him on Dec. 13.    
 Remembering President Kim Il Sung, he highly praised the Songun leadership of Kim Jong Il who has successfully carried forward the President's cause and underscored the need to steadily boost the relations between the two countries that have favorably developed.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Mun Myong On
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Mun Myong On 
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il sent a wreath to the bier of Mun Myong On, vice department director of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Dec. 18, expressing deep condolences over his death.

articles.title: U.S. Ambassador's Malarkey under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Ambassador's Malarkey under Fire in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- South Korean political circles recently accused the U.S. ambassador of making reckless remarks, according to the south Korean KBS and MBC.
 Kim Won Gi, speaker of the "National Assembly" of south Korea, said over a radio on Dec. 15 that it went beyond the tolerance limit that the U.S. ambassador made rough remarks terming the north a "criminal government" and that his remarks unfavorable for ensuring peace on the Korean Peninsula were undesirable.    
 Kim Won Ung, assemblyman from the Uri Party who is member of the Unification and Foreign Relations Committee of the "National Assembly", on Dec. 13 said that the reckless remarks of the U.S. ambassador were prompted by the "intention to disturb peace in the Korean Peninsula". He emphasized that if the U.S. ambassador continues to show such attitude, the "National Assembly" should push ahead with a resolution demanding his recall.
 He called a press conference on Dec. 14 at the "National Assembly" and asserted again that the NA should push forward a resolution on demand for the recall of the U.S. ambassador who made wrong utterances as a diplomat.

articles.title: Probe into Truth behind Murder of Peasant Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Probe into Truth behind Murder of Peasant Called for in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- South Korean Christian, Buddhist, Round Buddhist and Catholic believers reportedly held a rally at the Park of Citizens of Kwanghwamun in Seoul on Dec. 15 in demand of a probe into the truth behind the murder of peasant Jon Yong Chol and a guarantee for the vital rights of the peasants.
 A declaration signed by over 450 religionists of four orders was read out at the rally. It said that probe into the truth behind the murder of peasant Jon Yong Chol should not be delayed any longer, stressing that they demand the reflection of the government and relevant bodies and the clarification of their positive will to solve the problem.

articles.title: Conference of Educators in North and South Held
articles.content:
Conference of Educators in North and South Held 
    Kaesong, December 20 (KCNA) -- A conference of educators in the north and the south of Korea was held in Kaesong on Dec. 19 to implement the June 15 joint declaration.
 Present at conference were representatives of educators from the north and the south.    
 The conference reviewed the successes gained in national education for the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration in this significant year and discussed the ways for educators in the north and the south to conduct a positive solidarity movement for national reunification in the idea of "By our nation itself."

articles.title: Ridiculous Move of S. Korean Pro-U.S. Elements under Fire
DPRK System Will Be More Consolidated
S. Korean Youths and Students Denounce U.S. Forces' Mean Action
articles.content:
S. Korean Youths and Students Denounce U.S. Forces' Mean Action
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- Members of the youth and students organizations in south Korea reportedly held a press conference near the premises of the U.S. embassy in Kwanghwamun of Seoul on Dec. 16 to strongly denounce the U.S. forces in south Korea for having prevented two members of the Anti-U.S. Youth League from entering Kaesong to attend the third meeting of representatives of the youth and students organizations in the north and the south for the implementation of the June 15 joint declaration.
 The chief of the league and other speakers at the press conference recalled that the members of the league were allowed by the Ministry of Unification to attend the function of youth and students organizations of the south and the north but the "UN Forces Command" prevented them from entering Kaesong, taking issue with the name of the organization. This clearly proves that the command is no more than a mechanism serving the U.S. 
 A statement of the league read out at the press conference strongly demanded the immediate disbandment of the command, terming the above-said action a move against the Koreans' movement for reunification to block the advance of the youth and students in the south and the north toward peace and reunification.    
 The league together with the youth and students headquarters under the joint national committee for implementing the June 15 joint declaration will directly convey a letter of protest to the U.S. 8th Army Command and conduct counter-actions, the statement declared.

DPRK Sends Back Russian-Flagged Ship "Ternei"
articles.content:
DPRK Sends Back Russian-Flagged Ship "Ternei"
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- Russian-flagged ship "Ternei" entered the territorial waters of the DPRK on Dec. 5, 2005 with neither prior notice to it nor approval by it, according to a report from a relevant institution. The ship neither responded to the DPRK's interception nor accepted its just demand for mooring at the nearest port for an investigation. Even during the investigation the ship did not properly present documents related to its navigation but destroyed all the materials that could be evidence, increasing the suspicion.
 The Russian ship is entirely to blame for the delayed investigation because it has not complied with our demand in time.    
 The ship finally responded to our demand and its captain admitted the fact that his ship entered the banned waters of the DPRK side and did not respond to its interception in time. He expressed regret at this and assured the DPRK side that such a thing would not occur again. The DPRK side, therefore, decided to send the ship back on Dec. 19 with the DPRK-Russia relations into due consideration.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Palestinian Ambassador
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Palestinian Ambassador
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, met and conversed with Palestinian Ambassador e.p. to the DPRK Shaher Mohammed Abdlah who paid a farewell call on him today.

articles.title: Delegation of KCR Leaves for Bangladesh
articles.content:
Delegation of KCR Leaves for Bangladesh
    Pyongyang, December 20 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Korean Council of Religionists led by its President Jang Jae On left here Tuesday to participate in the meeting of the executive council of the Asian Conference for Religion and Peace to be held in Dhaka, Bangladesh.
